plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: Sunflowers are tall, annual plants known for their large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun's movement across the sky. They often grow wild and are widely cultivated for their seeds and oil.
plants.bloomingSeason: Mid summer to early fall (July to September)
plants.location: Northern Hemisphere temperate regions, including North America and Europe
plants.funFact: Sunflower heads can contain up to 2,000 individual flowers, known as florets.

plants.name: Lilium speciosum
plants.description: A striking species of lily that produces fragrant, large, showy pink to white flowers with dark spots. It is native to Japan and blooms in late summer to early fall.
plants.funFact: The Japanese Lily contains compounds that are toxic to cats, causing kidney failure if ingested.

plants.name: Acacia melanoxylon
plants.description: A fast-growing evergreen tree producing cream-colored fluffy flower spikes. Native to southeast Australia, it blooms in late winter to early spring in the Southern Hemisphere, which corresponds to September to November.
plants.funFact: Blackwood Acacia wood is highly valued for furniture making due to its dark and attractive grain.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A hardy wildflower producing golden-yellow daisy-like flowers with dark brown centers. Common in meadows and roadside areas, it blooms late summer to fall.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susan's seeds provide food for birds, and the plants attract butterflies and bees as pollinators.
